Title: Network Security Engineer
Job_Description:
Our Loews Hotels & Co Home Office teams provide support to all our properties throughout the United States and Canada. Our talented teams provide guidance over strategic planning, operations, revenue management, communications, marketing, finance, human resources, and information technology. This position is based at the Loews Hotels & Co Business Services Center in Franklin, TN.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities
Support and maintain Network Security platforms and processes including Next Generation Firewalls, Network Access Control, Remote Access, SDN Infrastructure, SIEM, IDS/ IPS, Vitural Private Networks, and Cloud Security Technologies.
Partner with senior team members and the other IT departments to assess the overall security posture of the network environment including security event detection, triage and threat analysis

Title: Data Acquisition and Optimization Analyst
Job_Description:
Headquartered in New York City, located in midtown Manhattan on New York’s famed Eastside, our Loews Hotels & Co Home Office teams provide support to all our properties throughout the United States and Canada. Our talented teams provide guidance over strategic planning, operations, revenue management, communications, marketing, finance, human resources, and information technology.
**The ideal locations for this role are Nashville or Orlando. Remote workplace flexibility is offered. **
Purpose
Loews Hotels & Co. is seeking a Data Acquisition and Optimization Analyst with experience with the hospitality industry. We are looking for a dedicated professional to be a part of our Information Technology team. Every role has an impact on our guests’ experience and you have the opportunity to make a difference.

Title: Data Acquisition and Optimization Analyst
Job_Description:
Located just outside the Universal Orlando™ theme parks, our Lakewood Regional Support Facility serves as the central operation for all our on-site hotels. Lakewood provides resources to the hotels for various departments, including Human Resources, Purchasing, Accounting, Security, Group Reservations, Telecommunications, Technology and Laundry.
Job Summary:
Provide clerical and administrative support for the Risk Management Department and Administration Division by performing clerical tasks such as data input, typing, word processing, answering telephones, reading, and filing / documenting incoming correspondence. Organizes and maintains various databases used in Risk Management on daily basis. Responsible for data processing/tracking of all blood borne pathogen documentation and all other OSHA related paperwork and training documents. Completes requisitions and maintains inventories of office supplies. Assists in the compilation and production of statistical reports, used by Loews Hotels at Universal Orlando and the Loews Corporation.

Title: Data Acquisition and Optimization Analyst
Job_Description:
Position Overview
The Sr. Technical Lead, Htl & Br is a Mid-Tier technical Operator, focusing on small general session work, or assisting with larger general sessions. This is intended to be a bridge between technical lead and technical specialist and reports to an Operations Manager, Dir, Operations or DET.

Key Job Responsibilities
Equipment Operation
Ensures a flawlessly executed event through accurate and timely setup, operation, and breakdown of advanced audiovisual equipment as listed in the technical qualifications section.

Title: Data Acquisition and Optimization Analyst
Job_Description:
Headquartered in New York City, located in midtown Manhattan on New York’s famed Eastside, our Loews Hotels & Co Home Office teams provide support to all our properties throughout the United States and Canada. Our talented teams provide guidance over strategic planning, operations, revenue management, communications, marketing, finance, human resources, and information technology.
**The ideal locations for this role are Nashville or Orlando. Remote workplace flexibility is offered. **
Purpose
Loews Hotels & Co. is seeking a Data Acquisition and Optimization Analyst with experience with the hospitality industry. We are looking for a dedicated professional to be a part of our Information Technology team. Every role has an impact on our guests’ experience and you have the opportunity to make a difference.
As a Data Acquisition and Optimization Analyst, you will be responsible for assisting in the design, development, and administration of our data warehouse. Candidates must have a working knowledge of relational database management systems and relevant tools, with some data modeling experience. Candidates must have strong communication skills that allow you to regularly interact with operations and business peers as well as with specialists from other related fields. Candidates must be analytical with strong problem-solving skills and possess a good grasp of the technical side of data storage and reporting technologies.
